messages.text:
https://codereview.appspot.com/7137049/diff/5001/doc/articles/race_detector.html
File doc/articles/race_detector.html (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7137049/diff/5001/doc/articles/race_detector.html#newcode9
doc/articles/race_detector.html:9: Data races are one of the most common and hardest to debug types of bugs in
no need to reformat the code as Go doesn't enforce
some maximum number of characters per line.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7137049/diff/5001/doc/articles/race_detector.html#newcode27
doc/articles/race_detector.html:27: m["2"] = "b"          // Second conflicting access.
please update the code based on gofmt formatting.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7137049/diff/5001/doc/articles/race_detector.html#newcode194
doc/articles/race_detector.html:194: fmt.Println(i)  // Not the 'i' you are looking for.
reformat this code snippet with gofmt.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

https://codereview.appspot.com/7137049/diff/5001/doc/articles/race_detector.html File doc/articles/race_detector.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7137049/diff/5001/doc/articles/race_detector.html#newcode344 doc/articles/race_detector.html:344: sync/atomic package. trailing slash after atomic to in link to avoid a redirect (as long as this CL is just minor cleanups anyway)
I don't see the point of wrapping all the lines. Your editor can do this for you.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, bradfitz@golang.org, minux.ma@gmail.com, adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.
